Authors:
Nimali Indeewari de Silva, Maharachchikumbura Sandeshya
Maharachchikumbura, Jayarama D. Bhat, Rungtiwa Phookamsak, Abdullah
Mohammed Al-Sadi, Abdullah Mohammed Al-Sadi, Saisamorn Lumyong, Kevin
Hyde
Title:
Monochaetia sinensis sp. nov. from Yunnan Province in
China
Keywords:
molecular phylogeny, morphology, novel taxon, taxonomy,
β-tubulin
Abstract:
This work embodies description of a novel Monochaetia
species, collected from a Quercus species from Lijiang, Yunnan, China.
Morphologically, it conforms with the characters of Monochaetia by
presence of a single apical and basal appendage on the conidia.
Considering phenotypic measurements of conidia such as length of apical
and basal appendages, conidiogenous cells and molecular phylogeny of
partial large subunit rRNA (LSU), internal transcribed spacers (ITS) and
β-tubulin (TUB), our taxon is distinguished from other Monochaetia
species. Therefore, here we introduced Monochaetia sinensis as a novel
taxon with comprehensive description and illustration.
